Exaggerate: The claim may be exaggerating the effectiveness of deploying the Texas National Guard to the Texas-Mexico border by stating that apprehensions declined by 74 percent.
Lack enough support: The claim does not provide enough evidence or support to back up the statement that apprehensions at the border declined by 74 percent.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that the decline in apprehensions is solely due to the deployment of the Texas National Guard, without considering other factors that may have contributed to the decline.
Exist alternative explanation: There may be alternative explanations for the decline in apprehensions at the border, such as changes in border patrol strategies or other external factors.
